summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Takers [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2013/02/12 Store: Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Review Title: Ugh.... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/02/13 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} Review Text: After finally taking advantage of my Amazon Prime membership's video feature the first show I began watching was "Justified' after hearing people (most notable Robin Quivers) say how good it is. I have to agree- it's well acted, written and directed. My favorite actor on the show after Timothy Olyphant is Erica Tazel. Review Title: Enjoying discovering 'Justified'! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/06/17 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Chappelle', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Clark Johnson', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Steve Shill', 'Daniel Attias', 'Timothy Van Patten', 'Agnieszka Holland', 'Brad Anderson', 'Clement Virgo'], 'Producers': ['David Simon', 'Robert F. Colesberry', 'Nina Kostroff Noble'], 'Starring': ['Dominic West', 'Sonja Sohn', 'Lance Reddick'], 'Studio': ['HBO Max']} Review Text: Season 2 was a great successor to the 1st season- plenty of intrigue, crime, kingpins rising and falling. "The Wire" was an underrated gem! Review Title: Flat out great! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/06 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: Steve Buscemi is great in this series about Atlantic City, bootlegging and the rise of some of the most famous gangsters in American history. Review Title: Nearly perfect Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/07 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alan Ball', 'Daniel Attias', 'Rodrigo García', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Kathy Bates', 'Michael Cuesta', 'Michael Engler', 'Alan Poul', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Miguel Arteta'], 'Producers': ['Alan Ball', 'Robert Greenblatt', 'David Janollari', 'Alan Poul', 'Bruce Eric Kaplan', 'Rick Cleveland', 'Bob Del Valle', 'Lori Jo Nemhauser', 'Craig Wright'], 'Starring': ['Peter Krause', 'Michael C. Hall', 'Frances Conroy'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: A great show that was ahead of its time. Review Title: Great cast, writing and directing Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/02/17 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Mikkel Bondesen', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Jan David Frouman'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Well written and directed, 'Bosch' is a taut and well paced series with a very good cast.

I look forward to seeing a second season. Review Title: 'Bosch' is very good with a stellar cast Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/02/17 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Mace Neufeld', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'David Barron', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pine', 'Kevin Costner', 'Kenneth Branagh']} Review Text: Hmmm... Chris Pine simply doesn't have the presence that I expect from this role and Keiera Knightly was simply annoying and distracting as his love interest.

Mr. Branaugh had directed other action films with similar underwhelming results (the first 'Thor' movie nearly put me to sleep)... This was a decently entertaining movie but not overly satisfying.

IF there is a sequel diminishing Ms. Knightly's character and more emphasis on the action involving Mr Ryan would be my advice. Review Title: Not enough emphasis on the main character, too much on his wife, poorly directed Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/06/10 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: Ohh so good! Thumbs up to season 2! Nucky gets in a major jam and his reign at the top is threatened by those who respect and revile him yet you find out why he is no one to underestimate. Review Title: Season 2- the entertainment value and drama gets kicked up a few levels Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Archer Review Date: 2015/09/17 Categories: Comedy, Animation, Action Product Description: ['Archer is an animated, half-hour comedy that revolves around an international spy agency and its employees. Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']} Review Text: Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long. Review Title: Why? Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/01/17 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Producers': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Starring': ['Larry David', 'Jeff Garlin', 'Cheryl Hines'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']} Review Text: Larry David, the writer/performer responsible for creating 'Seinfeld' w/Jerry Seinfeld, is the world's most self-centered narcissist in the sublimely hilarious 'Curb Your Enthusiasm'. His personal relationships, marriage and interactions with people are all awkward opportunities that showcase the world isn't following his set of sometimes bizarre thoughts and rules. Consistently funny and headshaking! Review Title: 'Curb Your Enthusiasm': for the self-centered narcissist in us all Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/29 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge'], 'Starring': ['タイタス・ウェリバー', 'ジェイミー・へクター', 'エイミー・アキノ']} Review Text: Fast paced, action packed with good performances by all the actors...can't wait to see Season 3! Review Title: Thumbs up Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Review Date: 2016/06/29 Store: Harrison Ford (Actor), Mark Hamill (Actor), J.J. Abrams (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray Product Description: ['Product Description', "Visionary director J.J. Abrams brings to life the motion picture event of a generation. As Kylo Ren and the sinister First Order rise from the ashes of the Empire, Luke Skywalker is missing when the galaxy needs him most. It's up to Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, a defecting stormtrooper, to join forces with Han Solo and Chewbacca in a desperate search for the one hope of restoring peace to the galaxy.", 'Additional Features', 'How to redeem your digital code: 1. Find Code on Insert 2. Enter Code 3. Select Provider 4. Enjoy Movie!'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Director': 'J.J. Abrams', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Digital_copy, DVD+Blu-ray', 'Run time': '2 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 5, 2016', 'Actors': 'Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Adam Driver, Daisy Ridley', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD High Res Audio)', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios', 'Writers': 'Screenplay by Lawrence Kasdan & J.J. Abrams and Mi', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: Oh my- what an expensive mess! The newcomers are mediocre to horrible actors, the plot was lifted from other Star War movies and some of the holes in the plot were bigger than the Death Star.

Death/destruction is coming yet no attempt to flee the planet?

Young Darth Vader wannabee gets into a fierce light saber fight with someone who has never used a light saber yet was holding his own? How is that possible?!

An untrained person in the Force using mind tricks that, according to previous movies, only a trained Jedi can use?

Harrison Ford looked bored and Carrie Fisher was simply 'there'... good paychecks for both I suppose (Harrison got $25 million and a cut of the box office I heard).

The Finn character is this movie's Jar Jar Binks... I was prepared to have him killed off about 20 minutes into the movie (dang- he lives on for the sequels). This young actor is awful- all wide eye looks and zero acting ability.

The Rey character is all furrowed brow and, again, ZERO acting ability. If I never see these two (John Boyega and Daisey Ridley) in another movie I will be very happy (and I won't see them together again because there is no way I'm watching the inevitable sequels of this horrid film).

The character played by Lupita Nyong'o is such a laughable rip-off of Yoda... to think she did publicity saying she was in this movie when actually it is only her voice that is in the movie. If I didn't stay for the credits I would have never known which character she played!

It looks as if JJ Abrams has bitten off too many movie projects and this was a lazy, lazy directing and script writing effort... Disney made their money and the financial backers are happy. That is the most positive thing I can say about this movie of which I wouldn't watch again if came on free TV and there was nothing else on. I was looking at my watch 30 minutes into the movie! Review Title: Expensive mess... JJ Abrams took a huge misstep with this one. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Passengers [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2017/03/29 Store: Jennifer Lawrence (Actor), Chris Pratt (Actor), Morten Tyldum (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure Product Description: ['Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt star in a high-stakes adventure about two passengers, Jim and Aurora, onboard a spaceship transporting them to a new life on another planet. The trip takes a deadly turn when their hibernation pods mysteriously wake them 90 years before they reach their destination. As they try to unravel the mystery behind the malfunction, they begin to fall for each other only to discover that the ship itself is in grave danger. With the lives of 5000 sleeping passengers at stake, only Jim and Aurora can save them all.'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'November 12, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '043396471061', 'Director': 'Morten Tyldum', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 14, 2017', 'Actors': 'Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Laurence Fishburne, Andy Garcia', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Neal Moritz, Michael Maher, Ori Marmur, Stephen Hamel', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Chris Pratt turns in his usual wooden performance in a yawner of a sci fi movie. Jennifer Lawrence was fine in her role yet I found myself not caring about either character.

The plot is a bit ridiculous and the best acting in the film is turned in by Lawrence Fishburne who unfortunately suffers the fate of so many lone black actors in a film...

The plot is a bit thin and the directing not inspiring... Thank goodness this bombed at the box office so there will be no sequel. Review Title: Zzzzz.... Not the worse movie I've seen but certainly not good. Rating: 2.0 --------------------------------------------------

The Rey character is all furrowed brow and, again, ZERO acting ability. If I never see these two (John Boyega and Daisey Ridley) in another movie I will be very happy (and I won't see them together again because there is no way I'm watching the inevitable sequels of this horrid film).

The character played by Lupita Nyong'o is such a laughable rip-off of Yoda... to think she did publicity saying she was in this movie when actually it is only her voice that is in the movie. If I didn't stay for the credits I would have never known which character she played!

It looks as if JJ Abrams has bitten off too many movie projects and this was a lazy, lazy directing and script writing effort... Disney made their money and the financial backers are happy. That is the most positive thing I can say about this movie of which I wouldn't watch again if came on free TV and there was nothing else on. I was looking at my watch 30 minutes into the movie! Expensive mess... JJ Abrams took a huge misstep with this one. Passengers [Blu-ray] Jennifer Lawrence (Actor), Chris Pratt (Actor), Morten Tyldum (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure ['Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt star in a high-stakes adventure about two passengers, Jim and Aurora, onboard a spaceship transporting them to a new life on another planet. The trip takes a deadly turn when their hibernation pods mysteriously wake them 90 years before they reach their destination. As they try to unravel the mystery behind the malfunction, they begin to fall for each other only to discover that the ship itself is in grave danger. With the lives of 5000 sleeping passengers at stake, only Jim and Aurora can save them all.'] {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'November 12, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '043396471061', 'Director': 'Morten Tyldum', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 14, 2017', 'Actors': 'Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Laurence Fishburne, Andy Garcia', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Neal Moritz, Michael Maher, Ori Marmur, Stephen Hamel', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Chris Pratt turns in his usual wooden performance in a yawner of a sci fi movie. Jennifer Lawrence was fine in her role yet I found myself not caring about either character.

The plot is a bit ridiculous and the best acting in the film is turned in by Lawrence Fishburne who unfortunately suffers the fate of so many lone black actors in a film...

The plot is a bit thin and the directing not inspiring... Thank goodness this bombed at the box office so there will be no sequel. Zzzzz.... Not the worse movie I've seen but certainly not good.
prompt:
Based on the provided purchase history, generate three separate summaries focusing on different aspects of the user's experiences. Each summary should be under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. avoid repeating product names, specifications, or technical details: 1. POSITIVE: Describe only the positive experiences and what was liked. 2. NEGATIVE: Describe only the negative experiences and what was disliked. 3. OVERALL: Provide a overall summary including both positive and negative aspects. Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: Takers [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2013/02/12 Store: Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Review Title: Ugh.... I look forward to seeing a second season. Review Title: 'Bosch' is very good with a stellar cast Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/02/17 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Mace Neufeld', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'David Barron', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pine', 'Kevin Costner', 'Kenneth Branagh']} Review Text: Hmmm... Chris Pine simply doesn't have the presence that I expect from this role and Keiera Knightly was simply annoying and distracting as his love interest.

Mr. Branaugh had directed other action films with similar underwhelming results (the first 'Thor' movie nearly put me to sleep)... This was a decently entertaining movie but not overly satisfying.

IF there is a sequel diminishing Ms. Knightly's character and more emphasis on the action involving Mr Ryan would be my advice. Review Title: Not enough emphasis on the main character, too much on his wife, poorly directed Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/06/10 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: Ohh so good! Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']} Review Text: Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long. Review Title: Why? Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/01/17 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Producers': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Starring': ['Larry David', 'Jeff Garlin', 'Cheryl Hines'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']} Review Text: Larry David, the writer/performer responsible for creating 'Seinfeld' w/Jerry Seinfeld, is the world's most self-centered narcissist in the sublimely hilarious 'Curb Your Enthusiasm'. His personal relationships, marriage and interactions with people are all awkward opportunities that showcase the world isn't following his set of sometimes bizarre thoughts and rules. Consistently funny and headshaking! Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge'], 'Starring': ['タイタス・ウェリバー', 'ジェイミー・へクター', 'エイミー・アキノ']} Review Text: Fast paced, action packed with good performances by all the actors...can't wait to see Season 3! Review Title: Thumbs up Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Review Date: 2016/06/29 Store: Harrison Ford (Actor), Mark Hamill (Actor), J.J. Abrams (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray Product Description: ['Product Description', "Visionary director J.J. Abrams brings to life the motion picture event of a generation. As Kylo Ren and the sinister First Order rise from the ashes of the Empire, Luke Skywalker is missing when the galaxy needs him most. It's up to Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, a defecting stormtrooper, to join forces with Han Solo and Chewbacca in a desperate search for the one hope of restoring peace to the galaxy.", 'Additional Features', 'How to redeem your digital code: 1. Find Code on Insert 2. Enter Code 3. Select Provider 4. Enjoy Movie!'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Director': 'J.J. Abrams', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Digital_copy, DVD+Blu-ray', 'Run time': '2 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 5, 2016', 'Actors': 'Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Adam Driver, Daisy Ridley', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD High Res Audio)', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios', 'Writers': 'Screenplay by Lawrence Kasdan & J.J. Abrams and Mi', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: Oh my- what an expensive mess! The newcomers are mediocre to horrible actors, the plot was lifted from other Star War movies and some of the holes in the plot were bigger than the Death Star.

Death/destruction is coming yet no attempt to flee the planet?

Young Darth Vader wannabee gets into a fierce light saber fight with someone who has never used a light saber yet was holding his own? How is that possible?!

An untrained person in the Force using mind tricks that, according to previous movies, only a trained Jedi can use?

Harrison Ford looked bored and Carrie Fisher was simply 'there'... good paychecks for both I suppose (Harrison got $25 million and a cut of the box office I heard).

The Finn character is this movie's Jar Jar Binks... I was prepared to have him killed off about 20 minutes into the movie (dang- he lives on for the sequels). This young actor is awful- all wide eye looks and zero acting ability.

The Rey character is all furrowed brow and, again, ZERO acting ability. If I never see these two (John Boyega and Daisey Ridley) in another movie I will be very happy (and I won't see them together again because there is no way I'm watching the inevitable sequels of this horrid film).

The character played by Lupita Nyong'o is such a laughable rip-off of Yoda... to think she did publicity saying she was in this movie when actually it is only her voice that is in the movie. If I didn't stay for the credits I would have never known which character she played!

It looks as if JJ Abrams has bitten off too many movie projects and this was a lazy, lazy directing and script writing effort... Disney made their money and the financial backers are happy. That is the most positive thing I can say about this movie of which I wouldn't watch again if came on free TV and there was nothing else on. I was looking at my watch 30 minutes into the movie! Review Title: Expensive mess... JJ Abrams took a huge misstep with this one. The trip takes a deadly turn when their hibernation pods mysteriously wake them 90 years before they reach their destination. As they try to unravel the mystery behind the malfunction, they begin to fall for each other only to discover that the ship itself is in grave danger. Jennifer Lawrence was fine in her role yet I found myself not caring about either character.

The plot is a bit ridiculous and the best acting in the film is turned in by Lawrence Fishburne who unfortunately suffers the fate of so many lone black actors in a film...

The plot is a bit thin and the directing not inspiring... Thank goodness this bombed at the box office so there will be no sequel. Review Title: Zzzzz.... Not the worse movie I've seen but certainly not good. raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user consistently enjoys high-quality productions, highlighting well-written, well-acted series and films. They appreciate shows with strong narratives and character development, as illustrated by their enthusiasm for critically acclaimed series. Positive sentiments revolve around highly engaging performances from both established and emerging actors. The user values unique storytelling and praised the exceptional directing and writing seen in several series, often mentioning memorable characters and compelling plots that kept them entertained. Overall, the user finds immense satisfaction in discovering new favorites and rewatching classics with standout casts and exciting premises.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Conversely, the user has expressed dissatisfaction with several cinematic experiences, particularly criticizing poor acting, lackluster direction, and weak scripts. They noted feelings of boredom and disappointment, especially when films relied on excessive clichés or uninspired storytelling. A notable trend is their disdain for certain character portrayals and plot holes, which led to negative ratings. Overall, the user's critiques suggest a significant frustration with productions that do not meet their expectations for storytelling and creativity, leading to a decreased interest in particular sequels and franchises.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history reflects a discerning taste for quality media characterized by strong storytelling, direction, and acting. While they celebrate the engaging aspects of various series and movies, they are equally vocal about their frustrations with films that fall short of these standards. Their experiences reveal a pattern of deep appreciation for well-crafted narratives and a critical eye towards those that seem lazy or formulaic. This duality in engagement suggests that the user is both an enthusiastic consumer of entertainment and a critical evaluator of its quality, seeking consistent excellence in their viewing choices.

target_interaction.title: Entertaining and action packed
description: Oscar®-winner Charlize Theron stars as elite MI6's most lethal assassin and the crown jewel of her Majesty's secret intelligence service, Lorraine Broughton. When she's sent on a covert mission into Cold War Berlin, she must use all of the spycraft, sensuality and savagery she has to stay alive in the ticking time bomb of a city simmering with revolution and double-crossing hives of traitors. Broughton must navigate her way through a deadly game of spies to recover a priceless dossier while fighting ferocious killers along the way in this breakneck action-thriller from director David Leitch (John Wick).
